body:
Sigh... okay... my behavior has not been good lately. Pertaining in regards to the subject of MapDevs especially...

I was disrespectful and came off as coldhearted... I was rude and I often responded with "A lot of people on the MapDev don't deserve their ranks". True or not, I should've kept this opinion to myself. 

Its just that after almost 2 years of work in Avicus and old.avicus I got weary and felt that my work was not being rewarded enough. After some time I got deep-rooted anger and frustration. And it eventually exploded into snarky comments and rebuttals. 

Just know that this isn't who I truly am, I can be a kind and fair person. Its just that when I work this hard and I get nothing to show that my work is appreciated then I get angry. 

I should've gone about this a different and more peaceful way. Contacted the head MapDev or something. Instead, I let it pile up inside my heart and bad things soon happened. 

I just wanted to say I'm sorry to all the MapDevs. I really am :(

I apologized to most of them via skype, though I have to wait for em to respond...

The mods that were promoted: I might not know the reasons why you were promoted. I might not agree with the reason if i were to learn the reason. But the point is that I should've kept my opinion to myself, especially when it causes stuff like this.

But im really sorry and would like to apologize for my behavior. Hopefully we can put this in the past and move on

title: I'm sorry... :(

replies.body: It's alright Zin. The most important thing is that you realised your mistake and you're trying to correct it. :)
replies.body_tagged: It's alright Zin. The most important thing is that you realised your mistake and you're trying to correct it. :)

replies.body: Everyone deserves second chances, don't they?
replies.body_tagged: Everyone deserves second chances, don't they?

replies.body: I understand the anger build up, if not let out it goes bad fast. And letting it out isn't always easy. Take a break from what makes you angry, I mean, wow, that's alot of maps. I don't particularly know you, but I did get a feel that you had a bad rep. Take a break, get a clean slate. Its alright, (Basically about to say what Frozen said so, yeah. What she said.)
replies.body_tagged: I understand the anger build up, if not let out it goes bad fast. And letting it out isn't always easy. Take a break from what makes you angry, I mean, wow, that's alot of maps. I don't particularly know you, but I did get a feel that you had a bad rep. Take a break, get a clean slate. Its alright, (Basically about to say what Frozen said so, yeah. What she said.)

replies.body:
Thanks guys :)

However, I don't plan on taking a break anytime soon, in fact I'm making a unique map right now that is based on one of my most favorite movies.

It is the movie that i based most of my maps around. :)\

James Cameron's Avatar :D

James Cameron's Avatar :D

replies.body:
Its okay bud!

 Its good to know that you realized your mistakes and thats all that matters. :)

Everyone gets a second chance!
replies.body_tagged:
Its okay bud!

 Its good to know that you realized your mistakes and thats all that matters. :)

replies.body:
I personally believe TNT maps are a somewhat hard and complicated concept to introduce to Avicus so suddenly.
Perhaps you should try making a map that doesn't contain TNT for once? and see how that goes?
You know, trying to vary a bit and stuff. You're a really great terraformer so I'm sure that the result will be good!
And then you could slowly start working once again in TNT concepts and stuff, and very carefully!

Apologies accepted, also ;)

replies.body:
I made one map that didnt have much tnt, just 2 chests but they're hidden :) Its called EridaniCTW. 

I'll take your advice and make more maps without TNT usage. However, I'm re-introducing villager trades since they can work on Avicus now :D

replies.body:
Hey, it's okay, all humans make mistakes, its awesome that you identified your mistake and learned from it.

Personally, I have had many wonderful map-making experiences with you, and I really do appreciate each and every map you have submitted to The Avicus Network. Thank you. (Really excited for all your new, upcoming projects! c: )
